meanings.definition: To verify or confirm information by checking previous sources or records.
meanings.sent1: She backchecked the data before presenting it to her boss.
meanings.sent2: He always backchecked his notes to make sure they were accurate.
meanings.sent3: The detective backchecked the suspect's alibi and found inconsistencies.
meanings.sent4: The historian backchecked the ancient manuscript to uncover hidden truths.
meanings.sent5: Before publishing the article, the journalist meticulously backchecked every fact.

meanings.definition: To investigate or review something in order to ensure accuracy or completeness.
meanings.sent1: The auditor backchecked the financial statements to avoid errors.
meanings.sent2: The teacher backchecked the students' homework to provide feedback.
meanings.sent3: The chef backchecked the recipe to prevent any mistakes in the dish.
meanings.sent4: The scientist backchecked the experiment to validate the results.
meanings.sent5: The editor backchecked the manuscript for any grammatical errors before publishing.
